intro: Chaerophyllum posofianum, commonly known as the Posofian cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a mild, parsley-like scent. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or rocky habitats.
